candidates.name: Ven. Khenpo Sonam Tenphel
candidates.briefBio: Born 18 July 1974 in Rxekhe, Kham. Joined monastic life early, fled to India in 1993, studied at Ngagyur Nyingma Institute, Bylakuppe. Elected to the 14th, 15th, 16th & now 17th Parliament; served as Deputy Speaker before becoming Speaker.
candidates.educationalBackground:
- Higher Secondary
- Bachelor’s & Master’s in Buddhist Philosophy from Ngagyur Nyingma Institute
- Doctorate in Buddhist Philosophy (2011).
candidates.workExperience:
- Teacher/disciplianarian at Namdroling monastery
- Parliamentary roles
- currently Speaker.
candidates.otherInformation: - Nyingma religious school.

candidates.name: Ven. Khenpo Jamphal Tenzin
candidates.briefBio: Born 1982 Minyak; studied Larung Gar; abbot Dzogchen Monastery; MP (16th & 17th).
candidates.workExperience: - Teaching/administration Dzogchen Monastery.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Published two books
- charitable aid.

candidates.name: Ven. Kunga Sotop
candidates.briefBio: Born 1980 Derge Jondha; studied at Tergar Monastery; MP for 17th TPiE.
candidates.workExperience: - Teacher & monastery administrator.
candidates.otherInformation: - Youth ethics advocate.

candidates.name: Tenpa Yarphel
candidates.briefBio: Tibetan monk-politician from Kham; studied at Sera Je Monastic University and Sarah Institute; previously edited monastic history.
candidates.workExperience:
- Editor at CTA Religious & Cultural Dept
- MP.
candidates.otherInformation: - Known for reformist outlook.

candidates.name: Ven. Lopon Thupten Gyaltsen
candidates.briefBio: Born 1980 Markham; monk since 8; escaped 2000; studied Sakya Centre/Institute; MP (16th & 17th).
candidates.workExperience:
- Teacher Sakya Institute
- settlement admin
- editor.
candidates.otherInformation: - Committee member & Tibet outreach.

candidates.name: Ven. Khenpo Kada Ngedup Sonam
candidates.briefBio: Born 1979 Karze; taught in Tibet; studied at Dzongsar Institute; received Karam‑pa and Kachu‑pa degrees; MP.
candidates.workExperience: - Teaching and monastic education.
candidates.otherInformation: - Culture & language promotion.

candidates.name: Ven. Geshe Lharampa Gowo Lobsang Phende
candidates.briefBio: Born 1977; Ba Zingon Monastery; exile 1992; Drepung Loseling; Geshe Lharampa; community leader; MP (16th & 17th).
candidates.workExperience:
- Leadership Mundgod communities
- committee service.
candidates.otherInformation: - Public Accounts Committee member.

candidates.name: Ven. Geshe Lharampa Atuk Tseten
candidates.briefBio: Born 1972 Lithang; joined monastery (1983); exile (1991); Drepung Gomang; Geshe Lharampa (2015).
candidates.workExperience:
- Teacher/scholar
- Drepung Gomang.
candidates.otherInformation: - Focus on youth ethics.

candidates.name: Ven. Geshe Atong Rinchen Gyaltsen
candidates.briefBio: Born 23 July 1981 in Drachen, Kham. Studied Tibetan medicine & rituals; fled to India 2005; studied Sutra & Tantra (Bön) at Menri Monastery; elected MP representing the Bön faith.
candidates.educationalBackground: - Geshe degree (Bön studies, equivalent to Ph.D.).
candidates.workExperience:
- Teacher & scholar in Bön tradition
- parliamentary service
- diaspora advocacy.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Represents Bön tradition in Parliament
- active in Europe and Africa advocacy.

candidates.name: Ven. Geshe Monlam Tharchin
candidates.briefBio: Born 1 Nov 1968 in Khyungpo Thingchen, Tibet. Studied Bon scriptures, tantra & mind-training; came to exile 1992; studied at Pal Shenten Menriling; served 6 years as Chant Master of Menri Sangha Assembly.
candidates.workExperience:
- Advisor & teacher for Bon scholars
- editor/proof-reader of major Bon works
- parliamentary service.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Represents Bon tradition
- active in cultural preservation & outreach.

candidates.name: Dolma Tsering Teykhang
candidates.briefBio: Born 1 July 1956 at Dagne, Tibet. Completed bachelor’s and teacher‑training; Taught 26 years in Tibetan schools; Fulbright scholar (USA, 2001). President of U‑Tsang Central Executive Committee; Deputy Speaker since 2021.
candidates.workExperience:
- 26 years teaching
- leadership in U‑Tsang committee
- long parliamentary service.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Elected from U‑Tsang
- advocate for education and women.

candidates.name: Migyur Dorjee
candidates.briefBio: Born 1 Jan 1953 Thoding (Ngari); joined CTA (1976); served 37 yrs — Chief Rep Ladakh, Secretary Dalai Lama’s Bureau, Rep UK & South Africa, Kadrung Cabinet Secy; MP (16th & 17th).
candidates.workExperience:
- CTA service 1976–2013
- various senior roles & diplomatic posts.
candidates.otherInformation: - Deep experience in CTA & diplomatic service.

candidates.name: Ngodup Dorjee
candidates.briefBio: Born 1956; long CTA and UN service career; elected MP.
candidates.workExperience: - Administrative/development service.
candidates.otherInformation: - Known for administrative leadership.

candidates.name: Lobsang Gyatso Sithar
candidates.briefBio: Born 22 Jun 1982 Dharamsala; UTCV alumnus; B.Sc (Comp Sci) Loyola College (Gold Medalist); Software Engg London Met Univ. Leader in digital security & diaspora tech; member WIRED Smart List 2021.
candidates.educationalBackground:
- B.Sc (Comp Sci), Loyola College Chennai
- Software Engg, London Met Univ.
candidates.workExperience:
- Tech lead
- advisor Citizen Clinic UC Berkeley (2018‑20)
- cyber security activist.
candidates.otherInformation: - Diaspora tech innovator & youth advocate.

candidates.name: Tsering Yangchen
candidates.briefBio: Elected from Ü‑Tsang; part of Standing Committee.
candidates.otherInformation: - Community representative.

candidates.name: Rigzin Lhundup
candidates.briefBio: Listed as MP from U‑Tsang in the 17th TPiE Directory. Further details not publicly available.
candidates.otherInformation: - Profile information incomplete.

candidates.name: Lhagyari Namgyal Dolkar
candidates.briefBio: Born 1986 in Dharamsala; first Tibetan woman to obtain Indian citizenship (2011); political activist and human rights advocate.
candidates.workExperience:
- Teacher
- Gu‑Chu‑Sum Association president
- MP.
candidates.otherInformation: - Focus on youth and women empowerment.

candidates.name: Dawa Tsering
candidates.briefBio: Born 1954 Tibet; fled to India; founder of Yongling School; twice Dharamsala Settlement Officer; veteran MP.
candidates.workExperience:
- Settlement Officer
- educator
- relief work.
candidates.otherInformation: - Long public service career.

candidates.name: Tenzin Choezin
candidates.briefBio: Schooling TCV; BA Madras College; MA JNU; Executive Director Active Nonviolence Education Center; youngest MP.
candidates.workExperience: - Career Centre, TWA, ANEC.
candidates.otherInformation: - Trainer of 5000+ youth.

candidates.name: Samten Chodon
candidates.briefBio: Graduated B.Com from Teresian College, Mysore (1992). 23 years service in Bylakuppe. Assistant Accountant (1993‑94), Auditor (1995‑97), Manager at Lugsung Samdupling Co‑op (1998–present). Sworn in replacing former MP Dawa Phunkyi.
candidates.workExperience:
- Auditor
- Manager, Lugsung Samdupling Co‑op
- CTA finance background.
candidates.otherInformation: - Women’s advocacy & finance leadership.

candidates.name: Dorjee Tseten
candidates.briefBio: Born 1983; international activist; Director Students for a Free Tibet Intl.; MP (16th & 17th).
candidates.workExperience:
- Director SFT International
- activism.
candidates.otherInformation: - Youth mobilization focus.

candidates.name: Youdon Aukatsang
candidates.briefBio: Four‑term MP; 22 years in Tibetan NGOs; Reagan‑Fascell Democracy Fellow (2021).
candidates.workExperience: - Leadership TWA, TCHRD, EVP.
candidates.otherInformation: - Focus on democracy & rights.

candidates.name: Juchen Kunchok Chodon
candidates.briefBio: Born 1972; MP since 2001 (13th–17th); visited North and South Americas, Russia, Australia; committee roles; Vice‑President Dege Gyalyong Lhentsok.
candidates.workExperience:
- Parliamentarian
- committee leadership.
candidates.otherInformation: - Public grievance work and outreach.

candidates.name: Tenzin Jigdal
candidates.briefBio: Born 1982; educated in India & UK; Director Intl. Tibet Network; human‑rights trainer (ISHR Geneva).
candidates.workExperience:
- Leadership SFT UK/India
- Advisor Tibet Action Inst.
candidates.otherInformation: - Focus on non‑violence and tech advocacy.

candidates.name: Serta Tsultrim
candidates.briefBio: Born 1978 Serta; former CTA editor; Founder Khawa Karpo Tibet Culture Centre; Editor Bod‑kyi‑Bangchen.
candidates.workExperience:
- Editor CTA Religion Dept
- Research Norbulingka.
candidates.otherInformation: - Writer and cultural activist.

candidates.name: Choephel Thupten
candidates.briefBio: Born 1967 Bylakuppe; BA + Diploma Mass Media (Christ College); former RTYC President; MP.
candidates.workExperience:
- Youth leadership
- media engagement.
candidates.otherInformation: - Focus on youth development.

candidates.name: Tsering Dolma
candidates.briefBio: Born 1978 Shillong; BA NEHU; led RTYC & TWA Shillong; Chair Local Tibetan Assembly; MP.
candidates.workExperience:
- Youth & women’s leadership
- community governance.
candidates.otherInformation: - NE India community mobilizer.

candidates.name: Phurpa Dorjee Gyaldhong
candidates.briefBio: Born 1989 Minyak; schooling in Tibet; BA Tibetan language (Sarah College); MP (17th).
candidates.workExperience: - Education & community service.
candidates.otherInformation: - Young generation representative.

candidates.name: Konchok Yangphel
candidates.briefBio: General Secretary Intl. Maitreya Foundation; MP (16th, 17th); Standing Committee member.
candidates.workExperience:
- NGO leadership
- MP
- outreach.
candidates.otherInformation: - Europe and Africa advocacy tours.

candidates.name: Wangdue Dorjee
candidates.briefBio: Born 1980 Bir; BA Punjab University; active youth leader; startup founder ‘Tibetfoods’.
candidates.workExperience:
- Local Assembly
- Chushi Gangdruk vice‑president
- entrepreneur.
candidates.otherInformation: - Business and social work.

candidates.name: Pema Tso
candidates.briefBio: Fled Tibet 2005; taught at schools; editor since 2018 of Tibet Times; MP (Dhomey).
candidates.workExperience:
- Teacher
- journalist
- editorial director Tibet Times.
candidates.otherInformation: - Strong female media voice.

candidates.name: Dhondup Tashi
candidates.briefBio: Born 14 Apr 1980 in Labrang, Amdo. Studied Buddhist philosophy, Tibetan lute & medicine; came to exile 2002; teacher, editor, journalist; ex-chief editor of Tibet Times; 16th & 17th MP.
candidates.educationalBackground:
- Buddhist & Western philosophy
- Northwest Minzu University
- English & computer studies (exile).
candidates.workExperience:
- Teacher at Transit School
- editor
- reporter & chief editor Tibet Times
- parliamentary committees.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Journalism background
- Dhomey representative.

candidates.name: Tsering Lhamo
candidates.briefBio: Born 10 Feb 1969 Ngaba. Translator in Ngaba; exile 1992; journalist (RFA & VOA); CTA officer (Security & DIIR); 16th & 17th MP.
candidates.workExperience:
- Translator
- journalist
- CTA Joint Secretary
- website editor
- China desk head.
candidates.otherInformation: - Translated Dalai Lama’s 'My Land and My People' to Chinese.

candidates.name: Serta Tashi Dhondup
candidates.briefBio: Born 1972; hotel management career; GM Hotel Tibet International; MP for Asia seat.
candidates.workExperience:
- Hotel manager
- hospitality leader.
candidates.otherInformation: - Business‑community link to Tibetans in Nepal.

candidates.name: Sonam Norbu Ratsa
candidates.origin: Parents from Amdo Sharkock & Labrang Tashi Gomang
candidates.briefBio: Born 15 Jul 1980 India. BA Punjab Univ; Senior Consultant RBC (6 yrs); FMFC (4 yrs); NGO education volunteer; 16th & 17th MP.
candidates.workExperience:
- Banking & finance
- NGO education work
- parliamentarian.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Finance background
- Dhomey rep.

candidates.name: Karma Gelek
candidates.briefBio: Born 1 Jan 1962; school CST Mussoorie (1985); served 12 yrs SFF & 2 yrs security guard for H.H. Dalai Lama; local & traders’ association leader; MP (17th).
candidates.workExperience:
- SFF service
- Local Assembly chair 12 yrs
- association president
- committee member.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Long community service
- Dhomey focus.

candidates.name: Yeshi Dolma
candidates.briefBio: Born 24 Jan 1971 Dharamsala; TCV school; served RTWA, TWA & Dhomey Association; led peace march 2005; 14th–17th MP.
candidates.workExperience:
- RTWA, Central TWA, Dhomey Assoc.
- MP service.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Women’s rights activist
- peace advocate.

candidates.name: Lobsang Thupten
candidates.briefBio: Born 18 Nov 1981 Rebgong; exile 1998; studied social communication Delhi; secretary to Ven. Jigme Rinpoche; Welfare Officer Dhomey Assoc.; MP (17th).
candidates.educationalBackground:
- School TCV
- social communication studies Delhi.
candidates.workExperience:
- Secretary & Director Kunphen Rigney School
- Welfare Officer
- MP.
candidates.otherInformation: - Coordinator Dengyab Writers’ Association.

candidates.name: Ven. Geshe Ngaba Gangri
candidates.briefBio: Born 21 Sep 1982 Ngaba; Geshe degree (2011); NGO leader Mundgod; editor Tibetan Parliamentarian; 16th & 17th MP.
candidates.workExperience:
- NGO leadership
- editor
- association executive.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Published articles
- Dhomey representative.

candidates.name: Choedak Gyatso Shinglo
candidates.briefBio: Born 1 Feb 1989 Chenza; TCV Suja & Gopalpur; BA PolSci (Ramjas DU 2017); MA PolSci (IGNOU 2018); RTYC Secretary; MP (17th).
candidates.workExperience:
- Youth leader
- Global Tibetan People’s Movement
- Local Assembly Dharamsala.
candidates.otherInformation:
- Young representative
- focus on education & youth.

candidates.name: Tenzing Jigme
candidates.briefBio: Born 1981 Kathmandu; moved to USA (1999); founded Students for a Free Tibet branch; ex‑President Tibetan Youth Congress.
candidates.educationalBackground:
- BA Colorado College
- MA University of Minnesota (ongoing).
candidates.workExperience:
- President TYC
- diaspora youth leadership.
candidates.otherInformation: - Advocates youth activism internationally.

candidates.name: Thupten Gyatso
candidates.briefBio: Born 1971; Buddhist scholar of Prajnaparamita; elected to 17th TPiE.
candidates.workExperience: - Religious teaching & administration.
candidates.otherInformation: - Cultural preservation focus.

candidates.name: Tenzin Phunstok Doring
candidates.briefBio: Born 26 Jul 1985; MPhil Political Science (Madras Christian College); student leader & researcher (TCHRD, Tibet Watch); Queensland campaigner 2018‑20; MP (17th).
candidates.workExperience:
- Student leader
- research & advocacy roles
- MP.
candidates.otherInformation: - Youth mobilizer & human rights advocate.

candidates.name: Lharong
candidates.briefBio: Lharong escaped to India at age eight and studied at Tibetan Homes schools. A top student and active youth leader, he has founded student bodies, led major events, and worked to promote civic engagement, education, and youth empowerment.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Schooling at Tibetan Homes Foundation, Mussoorie & Rajpur
• Topped CBSE Class XII board exams
• Recipient of Gaden Phodrang Student Merit Award
•  Masters in LLM
candidates.workExperience:
• Founding member & first president of AITSAM
• Organized Tibet Day exhibition at Mysore University
• General Secretary, International Students' Forum
• Represented Tibet in foreign student conferences
• Co-founded Regional Tibetan Legal Association, Mysore; served as vice-president
• Organized first legal panel on youth challenges & international cultural exchange programs
candidates.otherInformation:
• Co-founded school environmental club
• Organized creative Tibetan contests
• Founded Amay Norbu Book Club
• Organized fundraising events for civic causes
• Member of Youth for Democracy; helped host MP debate sessions across settlements

candidates.name: Gonpo Dhundup
candidates.briefBio: Former TYC President known for strengthening global youth mobilisation for Tibet through democratic and nonviolent advocacy. Recognised for shaping exile-youth leadership and elevating the Tibetan cause internationally.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Schooling at TCV Ladakh and TCV Gopalpur
• B.A. (Hons) Political Science, Kirori Mal College, University of Delhi
• Master’s in Public Policy, O.P. Jindal Global University
candidates.workExperience:
• President, Tibetan Youth Congress (2019; re-elected 2022)
• President, Foreign Student Association, Kirori Mal College
• President, Tibetan Youth Hostel Student Council, Delhi
• General Secretary, Regional Tibetan Youth Congress (Rohini)
candidates.otherInformation:
• Former Prefect & House Captain in TCV schools
• Founding member, Lhaksam Welfare Group
• Longstanding youth leader committed to community welfare and civic engagement

candidates.name: Chhimey Rigzen
candidates.occupation: Former Representative of H.H. the Dalai Lama for Central & Eastern Europe
candidates.briefBio: Born in Pemakoed, Tibet, Mr. Rigzen studied in exile in Darjeeling. He has served in many senior roles in the Central Tibetan Administration, including Representative, Secretary, Acting Secretary, and Settlement Officer across India.
candidates.workExperience:
• Representative of H.H. the Dalai Lama for Central & Eastern Europe
• Secretary, Department of Home, CTA
• Acting Secretary, Department of Health
• Acting Secretary, Department of Home (2016–2017)
• Settlement Officer in multiple Tibetan settlements
• Joined CTA in 1997 as Deputy Secretary, Kashag Secretariat
candidates.otherInformation: Joined CTA service in January 1997

candidates.name: Kongtsa Lhamo Tsering
candidates.briefBio: Born in Dharamshala and originally from Dingri Shelkar, she has served nearly 30 years in the CTA. She is known for her strong administrative skills, field experience, and commitment to community welfare and good governance.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Completed schooling at Upper TCV School, Dharamshala
• Graduated from the University of Vermont, USA
candidates.workExperience:
• 28 years of CTA service (1992–2022)
• Served in: Kashag Office, Permanent Strategy Committee, Department of Home, Department of Security, Department of Personnel & Estate
• Chief Representative Office, Bangalore
• Settlement Officer, Darjeeling Tibetan Settlement
• Settlement Officer, Tezu Dhargyeling Tibetan Settlement
candidates.otherInformation: • Focus on integrity, transparent administration, and public service within the Tibetan democratic framework

candidates.name: Kunga Thinley
candidates.occupation: President, Central Executive of Ngatri Tsokpa
candidates.briefBio: A dedicated community member committed to service, unity, and compassion. He has long been engaged with the Tibetan community across the Americas and aims to strengthen solidarity and preserve Tibetan identity through transparent and value-based leadership.
candidates.workExperience:
• Implied long-term community service
• Leadership roles within the Tibetan diaspora in the Americas
candidates.otherInformation:
• Campaign goals include strengthening unity, upholding Tibetan values, promoting transparent leadership, and contributing to the Tibetan cause with humility
• Encourages Tibetans in the Americas to work together for a stronger, more connected community

candidates.name: Kelsang Phuntsok Jugney
candidates.briefBio: A seasoned Psychiatric/Mental Health Registered Nurse with strong clinical experience, particularly in Electroconvulsive Therapy (ECT). Also an active community educator and organizer, combining medical expertise with grassroots engagement to promote mental health awareness and support.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Bachelor of Science (Registered Nursing)
• Associate Degree in Nursing
candidates.workExperience:
• Psychiatric/Mental Health RN
• Experience in ECT care and patient management
• Community mental health educator & organizer
candidates.otherInformation: • Serving our Youth, Preserving our Heritage, Strengthening our Movement.

candidates.name: Lobsang Dhondup
candidates.briefBio: A committed community worker actively involved in Tibetan youth, cultural, and social initiatives for over a decade. Known for leadership roles in Chandigarh and continuous service to Tibetan associations.
candidates.workExperience:
• President, Tibetan Youth Congress Chandigarh (2009 & 2010)
• President, Tibetan Freedom Movement
• Executive Member, Buddhist Association Chandigarh (2011–present)
• Member, Minorities Committee, Govt. of India, Punjab (2013–present)
• Organised Tibetan cultural song & dance program (2020)
• Organised ethnic self-introduction events
• Workshops on H.H. the Dalai Lama's Four Commitments (since 2018)
• Volunteer for First Central Tibet Youth Association event, Dharamsala (2025)
• Active involvement in TYC & TWA activities (2008–present)
• Assisted in organising Parliamentary tours & official visits in Chandigarh
candidates.otherInformation: • Strong focus on cultural preservation and youth engagement

candidates.name: Tenzin Namda
candidates.occupation: Former Chairman of Taiwan Tibetan Association

candidates.name: Waho Tenzin
candidates.briefBio: Waho Tenzin is a Tibetan-diaspora entrepreneur and community leader. He began as a road-construction worker in the 1970s and later built Tenzin Construction Company into one of the largest firms in Himachal Pradesh. He is known for both business success and long-term community service.
candidates.workExperience: • Owner & CEO, Tenzin Construction Company • Oversaw major construction projects including universities, hospitals, hotels, and government works • Served as Chairman/President of Shimla Local Tibetan Assembly for over 20 years
candidates.otherInformation: • Associated with Waho Tenzin Restaurant and Tenzin Hospital • Known for long involvement in public service and community leadership

candidates.name: Tsering Yangzom
candidates.briefBio: Originally from Rewoche and based in Dharamshala, she has served the Tibetan community for over 30 years. She has taken on major leadership roles in educational, social, and business organizations, showing a lifelong commitment to unity and community welfare.
candidates.workExperience:
• Teacher at Yongling School, Sambhota School Shillong & Nainital (1990–1997)
• Public Relations Officer, Dharamsala Tibetan Shopkeepers Welfare Society (2002–2006)
• President, Tibetan Shopkeepers Welfare Society (4 terms: 2009–2021; re-elected 2025)
• General Secretary, Mcleod Ganj PTA (2008–2010)
• Executive Member, Indo-Tibet Friendship Association (2010–present)
• Member, Vice President & President, Dharamshala Local Tibetan Assembly (2010–2019)
• President, Tibetan Chamber of Commerce, Dharamshala Zone (2007–2010)
• Vice President, Central Tibetan Chamber of Commerce (2011–2017)
• Vice President, Central Dho-toe Cholkha (2012–2018, 2022–present)
candidates.otherInformation:
• Over 30 years of community service
• Advocates for unity, accountability & community welfare
• Committed to serving with integrity and compassion

candidates.name: Lhatse Dawa Tsering
candidates.occupation: Executive Member of U-Tsang, President, Dharamsala Local Assembly

candidates.name: Ngawang Tenpa
candidates.briefBio: Born in Riwoche, Tibet and now based in Paris, he has over 22 years of dedicated service in Tibetan community organizations across Europe and Africa. He is known for his commitment to unity, cultural preservation, and advocacy for the Tibetan cause.
candidates.workExperience:
• Former President, Tibetan Community of France
• Former Vice-Chair, Nepal Chodjor Local Assembly
• Former Assistant Secretary, Central Executive Committee, Dokham Chushi Gangdruk
• Former President, France Local Chushi Gangdruk
• Local Sikyong & Chithue Election Committee Member
• Election Committee Member, Central & Local Chushi Gangdruk
candidates.otherInformation:
• Committed to representing Tibetans in Europe & Africa without discrimination
• Advocates for social harmony, cultural development & strengthening the Tibetan movement

candidates.name: Chenga Tsering
candidates.occupation: Executive Member, Central U-Tsang Cholkha Committee
candidates.briefBio: Born on 15 March 1974 in Arunachal Pradesh, he is a long-serving community leader with decades of contribution to Tibetan welfare, administration, and leadership. Known for steady service, he has led the Pemakoe Welfare Society across multiple terms and remains active in U-Tsang regional affairs.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Schooling at CST Darjeeling (Secondary & Senior Secondary)
• High School Diploma in General Studies (1988–1990)
• All India Senior School Certificate (Humanities) (1990–1992)
candidates.workExperience:
• 14+ years service in CTA Delhi (1992–2006)
• President, Pemakoe Welfare Society (2009–2013; 2016–present)
• Executive Member, Central U-Tsang Cholkha Committee (2019–present)
• Led welfare projects, fund management, community events & volunteer mobilization
candidates.otherInformation:
• Active representative of Pemakoe community across India
• Strong focus on welfare, governance & community unity

candidates.name: Dr. Sonam Tobgyal
candidates.briefBio: A dedicated researcher with strong academic training in History and long-standing involvement in youth leadership and community organizations. Active in research and Tibetan advocacy through academic and institutional work.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• PhD, Central University of Gujarat (2020)
• MPhil, Central University of Gujarat (2014)
• Master’s in History, M.S. University, Baroda
• B.A. (Hons) History, University of Delhi
candidates.workExperience:
• Researcher, Tibet Watch Research Centre (2018–present)
• Organizing Committee Member, 5th International Rangzen Conference (2018)
• Education Secretary, RIYC Dharamshala (2015–2018)
• Member, Students’ Council, CUG (2013–2014)
• President, RIYC Baroda (2011–2012)
• President, RIYC Rohini, Delhi (2009–2010)

candidates.name: Tsetan Phuntsok
candidates.occupation: Community leader, activist & former CTA official
candidates.briefBio: Raised in a politically active Tibetan family, he was inspired by his father’s service and commitment to unity at Hunsur Rabgayling. Known for strong oratory and firm yet calm leadership, he has become a respected voice in Tibetan public affairs in India and abroad.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Completed higher education in Bangalore
• Served as President, Regional Tibetan Youth Congress during student years
candidates.workExperience:
• Hunsur Woolen Handicraft Center (Dept. of Finance) – admin & finance roles
• Manager, Hotel Tibet, Dharamshala
• Interim CEO, Federation of Tibetan Cooperatives India Ltd. (FTCI)
• Vice President, Tibetan Association of Northern California (TANC)
• President & leading member, General Public Advocacy Body
• Led hunger strikes & sit-ins advocating reinstatement of the Tibetan Judiciary
• Key contributor to restoring the Tibetan Judiciary & strengthening CTA democratic accountability
candidates.otherInformation:
• Deep understanding of the three pillars of Tibetan democracy
• Advocates unity beyond regional/sectarian lines
• Candidate for 2026 Tibetan Parliament-in-Exile (North & South Americas seat)
• Pledges to promote integrity, transparency & unity among Tibetans worldwide

candidates.name: Tenzin Lobsang Khangsar
candidates.occupation: Australia Tibet Council, Co-chair, Board of Directors

candidates.name: Sonam Dorjee
candidates.briefBio: Sonam Dorjee is a committed community worker and long-time CTA staff member. Born in Tibet, he worked as an accountant before coming to India in 2000. For over two decades, he has actively served the Tibetan community through leadership, public service, and strong involvement in Rangtsen and Future Tibet advocacy.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Senior school passed
• Studied English & Tibetan at Sherab Gyatsel Loling (2 years)
candidates.workExperience:
• Accountant in Tibet – 3 years
• Department of Security, CTA – 18 years
• Vice President, Newcomer Association, Dehradun – 2 years
• Secretary & Accountant, Sherap Sangpo Society – 6 months
candidates.otherInformation:
• Active Rangtsen (Independence) advocate
• Committed Future Tibet activist
• Strong involvement in newcomer support & community welfare

candidates.name: Acharya Yeshi Phuntsok
candidates.briefBio: Born in 1962 in Leh, Ladakh, Acharya Yeshi Phuntsok has decades of experience in Tibetan politics, education, advocacy, and international engagement. He is known for his leadership in political parties, academic institutions, and global Tibet support networks.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Graduated from CST Shimla
• Acharya Degree, CIHTS Varanasi (1988)
candidates.workExperience:
• Served at CIHTS (1989–1991)
• Academic administrator & Tibetan language teacher, TCV Suja (1992–1996)
• Joint Secretary, National Democratic Party of Tibet (1994–1996)
• President, National Democratic Party of Tibet (1997–2004)
• Organizer, 1st International Tibet Support Group Meeting, Dharamshala (1989)
• President, Ngari Chithun Association
• Executive Programme Officer, Tibetan Parliamentary & Policy Research Centre
• Attended UNCHR Sub-Committee Session, Geneva (2000)
• Attended multiple national & international conferences (1997–2004)
candidates.otherInformation:
• Founder, Bharat Tibet Sahyog Manch (1999)
• Board Member, Tibetan Culture (2013)
• Board Member, Central University of Tibetan Studies, Varanasi (2013)
• Member, Maha Buddhist Society of India (since 2014)
• Advisor, Sowarigpa Tibetan Medicine (since 2015)
• Advisor, ITFA Dharamshala (since 2015)
• Elected Member of 14th & 15th Tibetan Parliament-in-Exile

candidates.name: Ngawang Lodoe
candidates.occupation: Founder & President, Tibetan Himalayan Public School
candidates.briefBio: A long-serving community leader from Kamrao Tibetan Settlement, deeply dedicated to the Tibetan cause. He has held multiple leadership roles supporting community welfare, cultural preservation, and public service. His founding of the Tibetan Himalayan Public School reflects his strong commitment to education and youth development.
candidates.workExperience:
• Three-term President, Regional Tibetan Parliament (Bhod Chithue)
• Three-term Executive Member, Chul-Che Gandu
• President, Tibetan Himalayan Public School
• Founder, Tibetan Himalayan Public School
candidates.otherInformation:
• Strong advocate for education, culture & community welfare
• Promotes opportunities for Tibetan & Himalayan children

candidates.name: Gyaltsen Choekyi
candidates.briefBio: Born in Amdo (Nagchu Prefecture, Kham), came into exile in 2009. She now lives in Dharamsala and teaches at Norbulingka Institute. She has strong academic training in Tibetan language, philosophy, and culture, and is committed to preserving Tibetan heritage.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Primary School – Amdo County School
• Middle & High School – Nagchu City School
• Teacher Training Course – Lhasa Teachers College
• Sherab Gatsel School (in exile)
• Advanced studies in Buddhist philosophy, grammar, poetry & history – Gelugpa Nunnery
candidates.workExperience:
• Teaching Faculty, Norbulingka Institute (2022–present)
• Presented research paper at Young Researchers Conference, Tibet Policy Institute
• Participated in several academic seminars & conferences
• Trilingual training (Tibetan, Chinese, English) from middle school
candidates.otherInformation: • Focus areas: preserving Tibetan language, studying Chinese politics, bringing Tibetan issues to global platforms

candidates.name: Tenzin Yangzom
candidates.occupation: Community leader & former Settlement Officer, Sonada Tashiling
candidates.briefBio: A dynamic Tibetan professional dedicated to youth empowerment, community development, and public service. Her leadership roles across Delhi, Dharamshala, and Sonada reflect her commitment, compassion, and competence. Her international academic training strengthens her global perspective and community service.
candidates.educationalBackground:

• B.A. (Hons.) English, SPM College, Delhi University

candidates.otherInformation:
• Advocates for education, gender equality & sustainable development
• Strong promoter of youth participation & Tibetan unity

candidates.name: Dekyi Wangmo
candidates.briefBio: Born in Dharamsala and originally from Bawa (Dho-Toe), she has dedicated her career to education, youth welfare, and cultural preservation. Based in Mussoorie, she has worked across multiple settlements and schools, focusing on empowerment, heritage, and community well-being.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Master's in Economics – HNB Garhwal University, Srinagar

candidates.otherInformation:

candidates.name: Ngedun Gyatso Drongpatsang
candidates.occupation: Former Vice President, Tibetan Association of Northern California
candidates.briefBio: A long-serving community worker with extensive experience in Tibetan cooperative institutions, youth leadership, and community organizations. Known for his dedicated service in India and North America.

candidates.name: Beru Tashi Dhondup
candidates.workExperience: President of the Tibetan Newcomers Welfare Associattion

candidates.name: Tashi Lamsang
candidates.briefBio: Born in Tibet and later escaped to India, he has dedicated 16 years to Tibetan freedom work, community service, youth engagement, and international advocacy. His travels across settlements and colleges in Asia and North America have given him deep insight into the needs of Tibetans inside Tibet and in the diaspora.
candidates.workExperience:
• Joined Raise the Tibetan Flag campaign (2008); distributed 5,000+ flags
• Initiated Talk Tibet weekly awareness forum (2008–2009)
• General Secretary, RTYC Dharamsala (2009–2013) — led major cultural, social & political programs; chapter awarded Best RTYC among 84 worldwide
• General Secretary, TYC Central Executive Committee (2013–2019) — strengthened leadership & reunited chapters in India & USA
• President, RTYC New York & New Jersey (2020–2022) — initiated first Asian American Alliance Conference
• Member, Future of Tibet initiative (2022–2023); co-organized global conferences
• Co-founder, Yarlung Center NYC (2024)
candidates.otherInformation:
• Strong commitment to H.H. the Dalai Lama's guidance & the CTA
• Focus on youth empowerment, cultural preservation & global Tibetan advocacy

candidates.name: Kunchok Rinchen
candidates.briefBio: Born in Sumpa, Nagshod, Driru, now residing in Dharamshala. A young and active Tibetan lawyer dedicated to justice, human rights, and the Tibetan freedom movement. Since arriving in India in 2006, he has grown from a student activist to a respected legal advocate and community leader, fluent in Tibetan and English.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Class 10 – TCV Suja (2013)
• Class 12 (Arts) – TCV Suja (2015)
• BA.LLB – Karnataka Law School (2015–2021)
• Tibetan Exile Lawyer's License (2018)
candidates.workExperience:
• President, Students' Rights Association, TCV Suja
• Led Solidarity for Tibet activities in school
• Chief Organizer, Peace March (Suja → Lhasa) with 100+ students (2012)
• President, RTYC Bengaluru — reunited chapter with TYC Centrex
• Co-organizer, 48th TYC Executive Meeting (2017)
• Co-led major protest during BRICS Summit (Goa, 2016)
• President, Bengaluru Tibetan Legal Association
• Hosted Sikyong Dr. Lobsang Sangay at CMR Law School
• Executive Member, International Law Students Association, Bengaluru
• Executive Member, CMR Law School Students Association
• General Coordinator, All India Tibetan Students Association Meet
• General Coordinator, 14th Tibetan Higher Education Students' Conference, Sera Jey
• Shared information with Human Rights Watch & other bodies
• Legal training & court experience in Bengaluru
• Four-year researcher for TCHRD's Crime Against Humanity in Driru
candidates.otherInformation:
• Committed to advancing Tibet's independence through international law
• Promises legal assistance to the Tibetan community
• Lifelong dedication to the Tibetan cause
• Campaign Slogan: Uphold Rule of Law; Strengthen Unity; Advance Tibet's Freedom; Defend Sovereignty

candidates.name: Dawa Tashi
candidates.briefBio: An experienced Tibetan educator serving as the Principal of STS Bylakuppe Camp 1 School, committed to improving educational standards and student development.

• Bachelor of Education, Varanasi
candidates.workExperience: • Principal, STS Bylakuppe Camp 1 School
candidates.otherInformation:
Committed to advancing Tibet’s independence movement through strategic advocacy

Aims to provide legal assistance to the Tibetan community

Will pursue legal challenges against China’s human rights violations when needed

Pledges lifelong service to the Tibetan cause in honor of H.H. the Dalai Lama and elder generations

Campaign Slogan: Uphold the Rule of Law; Strengthen Unity and Solidarity

candidates.name: Tsering Tharchin
candidates.briefBio: A specialist in Chinese language, politics, and international relations with academic training from India and Taiwan. His research focuses on China’s political developments and strategic behavior.

candidates.otherInformation:

candidates.name: Dr Lhundup Dorjee
candidates.briefBio: Dr. Lhundup Dorjee is a teacher from Bylakuppe, originally from Tehor. He aims to spread awareness about Tibet's history, promote Tibetan political issues internationally, and strengthen the bond between the Tibetan people and the exile government.
candidates.workExperience:
• Vision to promote awareness of Tibet's past and political issues internationally
• Focus on educating young Indians about pre-1959 Tibetan history
• Plans to preserve and promote Tibetan language
• Intends to encourage patriotism among Tibetan youth
• Aims to strengthen ties between the exile Tibetan government and the Tibetan community

candidates.name: Sonam Gyatso Anuthang
candidates.occupation: Vice President, Tibetan Association of Czech Republic
candidates.briefBio: An entrepreneur, translator, and author with a long-standing commitment to Tibetan advocacy. Founding member and first President of the Czech Tibet Association, now serving as its Vice President. Leads Nyampa Lharsö to promote cultural understanding and solidarity for the Tibetan cause.
candidates.workExperience:

• Vice President, Tibetan Association of Czech Republic

candidates.otherInformation: • Dedicated to cultural preservation, international advocacy & strengthening support for Tibet

candidates.name: Wangpo Tethong
candidates.occupation: Executive Director, International Campaign for Tibet (ICT) Europe
candidates.briefBio: Born in 1963 in Trogen, Switzerland to Tibetan refugee parents at Kinderdorf Pestalozzi. A lifelong activist, writer, and community leader deeply rooted in Tibetan culture while raised in Europe.
candidates.educationalBackground:
• Studied History & Law, University of Zürich
• Master’s degree (phil. I), University of Zürich (1997)
candidates.workExperience:
• Member, Tibetan Parliament-in-Exile (Europe constituency), elected 2014

• Co-editor, Bod Shon magazine (1989–1995)
• Media officer, Greenpeace Switzerland
• Spokesperson & Party Secretary, Green Party of Switzerland (Canton Zürich) (1997–1999)
• Co-founder/Contributor to: Lamtön Refugee Advice Center, Tibetan Freedom Radio, Filming for Tibet, Tibet Film Festival (2009)
• Conducted first Tiananmen Square protest by an exile Tibetan (2006)
• Freelance consultant in public affairs, communications & film
candidates.otherInformation:
• Author of scholarly and advocacy works
• Wrote monograph on Tibetan political elite (2000)
• Contributed chapter “Between Cultures: Young Tibetans in Europe” (2003)
• Co-authored environmental report for Greenpeace Switzerland (2006)
• Influential voice in European Tibet advocacy, culture, media & youth engagement

candidates.name: Kalsang Tsering
candidates.briefBio: A community leader with experience in education and public service. He has worked within the Central Tibetan Administration and contributed to strengthening Tibetan community life in Australia.

candidates.name: Kalsang Youdon
candidates.briefBio: With over 26 years of dedicated service, she has held major leadership roles including Vice President of Tibetan Women’s Association and President of the Bharat-Tibet Support Women’s Wing. She is committed to the Umay Lam (Middle Way) approach and works for the welfare of the entire Tibetan community under the guidance of His Holiness the Dalai Lama.
